intro: Schizocorona floribunda, commonly known as the showy sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the summer months. Schizocorona floribunda is often found in desert and coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
